sen.j: 牟漏女王（むろのおおきみ 生年不詳 - 天平18年（746年））は、日本の皇族。
sen.e: Muro no Okimi (year of birth unknown - 746) was a member of the Imperial family in Japan.
Muro no Okimi (year of birth unknown - 746) was a member of the Imperial Family in Japan.
sen.cmt: Imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。
sen.e: Muro no Okimi (year of birth unknown - 746) was a member of the Imperial Family in Japan.

sen.j: 美努王と県犬養三千代の子で、橘諸兄・橘佐為の兄弟。
sen.e: She was a daughter of MINU no Okimi and AGATA no Inukai no Michiyo and her brothers were TACHIBANA no Moroe and TACHIBANA no Sai.
She was a daughter of MINU no Okimi and AGATA no Inukai no Michiyo, and her brothers were TACHIBANA no Moroe and TACHIBANA no Sai.
She was a daughter of MINU no Okimi and AGATA no Inukai no Michiyo, and her brothers were TACHIBANA no Moroe and TACHIBANA no Sai.

sen.j: 母三千代と同じく宮廷に出仕し、後宮の高官になる。
sen.e: She served at the Imperial court and became a high officer in kokyu (empress's residence).
She served at the Imperial court same as her mother Michiyo, and became a high officer in kokyu (empress's residence).
sen.cmt: 「母三千代と同じく」を補いました。
sen.e: She served at the Imperial court same as her mother Michiyo, and became a high officer in kokyu (empress's residence).
Her court rank was Ikai (位階).
sen.cmt: 日本語の誤記でしょうか？それとも位階という位が存在したのでしょうか。その場合、定訳不明。
sen.e: Her court rank was Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: ウェブ上で確認し、こちらを使用しないと訳が困難なため、訳文に「正三位」を使用しました。"位階→ 正三位"
sen.e: Her court rank was Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).

sen.j: 興福寺のかつての本尊であった不空羂索観音像は、天平17年（747年）に死去した藤原房前の追善のために子の藤原真楯らと造立したもの。
sen.e: The Statue of Fukukensaku Kannon,former principal object of worship at Kofuku-ji Temple was built in memorial to FUJIWARA no Fusasaki who died in 747 by his son, FUJIWARA no Matate.

The Statue of Fukukensaku Kannon, the former principal object of worship at Kofuku-ji Temple was built by Muro no Okimi and his son, FUJIWARA no Matate and others, as the memorial to FUJIWARA no Fusasaki who died in 747.
sen.cmt: カンマを修正しました。the を補いました。「子の藤原真楯らと」の部分を考慮し修正しました。
sen.e: The Statue of Fukukensaku Kannon, the former principal object of worship at Kofuku-ji Temple was built by Muro no Okimi and his son, FUJIWARA no Matate and others, as the memorial to FUJIWARA no Fusasaki who died in 747.
